moves.1... e5: establishing a hold on the center
moves.2. Bb2: offers to trade the pawn on b4 for the pawn on e5
moves.2... d6: in retrospect, i should really have traded and then continued develping, but this isnt so bad
moves.4. Qf3: attacks the bishop and the pawn on b7
moves.4... Bxc2: i decide to open the game up and possibly trap his queen in the corner
moves.5. Qxb7 Nd7: develops the knight to its only safe square, protects the rook and stops the queen from check on c6
moves.6. Bb5: threatens Bxd7 either opening the king, or winning a rook if i blunder
moves.7. a3: not too sure about what this move accomplishes
moves.7... Rb8: the queen is almost trapped, if he takes the pawn then 8. Be4 basically wins the queen for a rook
moves.8... Nxd7 9. Qxa7 Be4: the queen needs to retreat along the a file
moves.10. f3: terrible mistake, after 10. Ra8 the queen is sunk
moves.10... Ra8 11. Qxa8: getting a rook at least, also opens the queenside for later attacks
moves.11... Bxa8: taking with the queen isnt bad, as it opens up his kingside, but i was playing conservatively
moves.12... g6: preparing to bring the bishop out and castle
moves.13. O-O Bh6 14. Nbc3 Nf6: bringing the attack to the kingside
moves.15. a4: trying to establish a pawn queening threat down the side of the board
moves.15... O-O 16. b5: continues to push pawns, making me a little nervous
moves.16... Nd5 17. a5 Nb4: attempting to stop those annoying pawns
moves.18. a6 Nc2: attacks a defender of the pawns
moves.19. Ra4: bring the rook to safety, maintaining the pawns, and trapping my knight
moves.19... Nxe3: i decide to trade the knight for 2 pawns and postion
moves.20. dxe3 Bxe3+ 21. Kh1 Qh4: for some reason, neither of us noticed that my queen was hanging, lucky for me
moves.23. g3: looks devastating, but the queen can sidestep and attack the rook
moves.23... Qh3 24. Rf2 Be3: while Rh4 does trap the queen...
moves.25. Rh4 Bxf2: !!! he resigns because if rook takes then 26. Bxf3#, else, 26. Qe1  followed by 27. Ng1 and 27. Qxg1#

gameName: My first time against the polish
